bwwExcerpt: Now Clarke, who won an Olivier award for her performance in the British production, adds hers. She makes of the maid an almost Shakespearean figure; even at the depths of the character's despair, in the scarifying 11 o'clock number "Lot's Wife," she commands attention without begging for it, and does not allow herself, because Caroline wouldn't, the luxury of collapse.
